article.title: De-Identifying Government Datasets

content.brief: De-identification removes identifying information from a dataset so that the remaining data cannot be linked with specific individuals. Government agencies can use de- identification to reduce the privacy risk associated with collecting, processing, archiving, distributing or publishing government data. This document provides specific guidance to government agencies that wish to use de-identification.

article.source: National Institute of Standards and Technology
article.subtitle: (CURRENTLY IN DRAFT)
